data.title: coherence_kernel × singularity_damping (Robotics Use-Case)
data.summary:
Applying the coherence_kernel architecture to high-DOF robotics. In 6+ axis arms, approaching a kinematic singularity creates effectively infinite gradient demands on joint velocities (a 'coherence rupture'). This pulse introduces the kinematic_coherence_kernel: instead of a hard stop, the kernel applies active_squeezing—rigorously maintaining end-effector precision (Phase) by dumping induced singularity stress into null-space motion (Amplitude). The conjugate_safety_interlock ensures this dumping never violates physical torque or velocity limits, trading exact path adherence for mechanical survival during complex maneuvers.
kernel_call: kernel: kinematic_coherence_kernel invariant:
  tag: singularity_damping
  goal: "Maintain smooth motion flux (Φ > 0.95) through Jacobian degeneracy"

caller:
  system_id: "7-DOF_Manipulator_Stack"
  controller_type: "impedance_control"

input_gradients:
  manipulability_index: "approaching_zero (0.05)"
  task_space_error: "requiring_correction"

coupling:
  mode: null_space_projection
  coupling_impedance: "variable_stiffness (softening near singularity)"

execution_constraints:
  - safety_interlock: "Max Joint Velocity < 2.5 rad/s"
  - active_squeeze: "Prioritize orientation_coherence over position_coherence"

outputs:
  actuation_command: "Damped least-squares solution applied"
  state_update: "Singularity traversed via null-space reconfiguration"
  diagnostics:
    phi_metric: "0.96 (smoothness maintained)"
    conjugate_dump: "High velocity variance absorbed in Elbow Joint (J3)"

structure: delta: >
  Kinematic singularity: a geometric configuration where the robot loses a
  degree of freedom, causing gradients (joint velocities) to spike toward
  infinity.
gc: >
  kinematic_coherence_kernel executes a null-space squeeze, preserving task
  coherence by expanding motion in redundant joints.
cf: >
  conjugate_safety_interlock enforces torque/velocity limits, acting as the
  physical boundary that overrides abstract geometric demands.
invariant: >
  Actuation continuity: preservation of smooth motion flux despite geometric
  defects in the workspace.
